Package chess.interfaces

Interface IChessMatch

All Superinterfaces:
IChessboard
All Known Implementing Classes:
ChessMatch
public interface IChessMatch extends IChessboard
Represents a chess match. Remark: This is your main access point to the chess game, its board state (the displacement of the pieces on the board), the moves each team is allowed to make legally etc. As this interface extends IChessBoard, it is suggested to read the IChessBoard interface for more information.

  • Method Details

    • getPlayer

      int getPlayer()
      Gets the player whose turn it is to make a move.
      Returns:
      An integer that is either 0 for team black or 1 for team white.

    • getState

      MatchState getState()
      Gets the state of the match.

    • interpret

      void interpret(String fen)
      Interprets a fen-string and updates the match accordingly.
      Parameters:
      fen - A full-fledged fen-string containing all 6 information fields. See Forsyth-Edward notation wiki for more information about it.

    • playMove

      void playMove(IChessPiece piece, IChessboardSquare destination)
      Moves a chess piece from its current square to a destination square. When done moving, gives the turn-to-play to the next player. Remark: In order to use this function properly, see getLegalMoves(int team) from the IChessBoard interface as that method returns the legal moves a team may make.
      Parameters:
      piece - The chess piece that is going to get re-positioned.
      destination - The square the chess piece is going to.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when an attempt is made to re-position the opponent's chess piece. So, if getPlayer() returns 0, only black pieces are allowed to reposition.

    • promote

      void promote(IChessPiece piece, char decision)
      Promotes a chess piece to another chess piece type (i.e., the function to promote a pawn to another type.).
      Parameters:
      piece - The chess piece that is getting promoted.
      decision - The targeted chess piece type that is going to replace the chess piece that is getting promoted.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when null is passed for the chess piece that is getting promoted or the target that is going to replace the promoted piece. -or- the passed chess piece can not be promoted.

    • toFen

      String toFen()
      Translate the current state of the match to a fen-string.

    • nextPlayer

      int nextPlayer()
      Returns:
      the next player

    • hasCastled

      boolean hasCastled(int team)
      Checks whether a team has castled.
      Parameters:
      team - The team for which the castling should be checked.
      Returns:
      true if team has castled
